channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Singapore is the only Southeast Asian country in Pax Silica, the U.S.’s new AI ‘inner circle’
item.description: Singapore is “precisely the kind of ‘trusted node’ the U.S. is seeking to anchor AI-era supply chains,” says Ruben Durante, a professor at Singapore's...

item.title: How Russia and Ukraine Are Fighting to Shape President Trump’s View of the War
item.description: Off the battlefield, each side is trying to influence the American leader’s perception as they look to negotiate a peace settlement in their favor.

item.title: Eurostar Faces Severe Delays After Power Failure
item.description: A power failure in the Channel Tunnel has paralyzed the Eurostar service, causing delays for thousands of holiday travelers between London, Paris and ...

item.title: A vicious cycle beats a virtuous one: How Warren Buffett’s Geico fell behind Progressive in the auto insurance race
item.description: While Geico was investing in marketing and neglecting IT, its rival Progressive was investing in technology and gaining market share.

item.title: Saudis Say Airstrike in Yemen Targeted Arms From U.A.E.
item.description: The Saudi-led coalition said a strike on a port in southern Yemen was targeting weapons bound for a separatist group that is backed by the United Arab...

item.title: AI adoption at scale is hard. Just look at India, which processes about 20 billion transactions every month
item.description: The most valuable AI systems will not look dramatic. They will look ordinary. They will fade into routine decisions and familiar processes.

item.title: Warren Buffett’s blind spot: Did the digital economy leave him behind?
item.description: Warren Buffett posted pedestrian investment returns over the last years of his career, due largely to a failure to grasp the potential of Big Tech.

item.title: Simon Sinek says not to worry about salaries during a job interview. Instead, ‘choose the job based on who you’re going to work for’
item.description: “Yes, I made less money than all of my friends in the short term,” Sinek said. But “I got an education and care from somebody who took me under their ...

item.title: China Fires Rockets Near Taiwan in Display of Military Power
item.description: China’s military also sent warships and aircraft during a second day of exercises designed to show its ability to claim the democratic island.

item.title: Overlooked Stories
item.description: We look at some of our best stories from 2025 that Times editors thought deserved more attention.

item.title: China Holds Live-Fire Drills Around Taiwan
item.description: Beijing mobilized naval and air forces in its first major military exercise on all sides of Taiwan since April, state media showed.
